shortDescription: John is a classically trained chef with a passion for blending flavors from around the world. He has worked in some of the top restaurants in the country and loves to experiment with new ingredients and techniques.

cards.cookingMethod: Stir-fry chicken with soy sauce and cornstarch, then add green onions and peanuts.
Boil chicken broth with vinegar, then add tofu, egg, and mushrooms.
Cook rice and scramble egg, then stir-fry with green peas, carrots, and soy sauce.

shortDescription: Jane has a background in pastry and dessert making, but loves to create savory dishes as well. Her specialties include homemade pasta and seafood.

ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
cards.cookingMethod: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
cards.cookingMethod: Cook the fettuccine according to package instructions. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chicken and garlic and cook for 5-7 minutes until browned and cooked through. Add the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Add the cooked fettuccine and toss to combine. Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 lb. sweet potatoes, peeled and chopped
1 lb. brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
cards.cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F. In a large bowl, toss the vegetables with the olive oil and salt. Spread the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring once or twice, until the vegetables are tender and caramelized.
